summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from December 2008 between Assistant U.S. Attorney A. Marie Villafaña and defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding scheduling a meeting about Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss whether Lefkowitz will attend a meeting on Thursday with someone named Roy.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Defense attorney communicating with a federal prosecutor about scheduling a meeting regarding Jeffrey Epstein. He is asked if he will attend a meeting on Thursday with Roy.

persons.context: Federal prosecutor based in West Palm Beach, Florida, initiating and participating in email correspondence with defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz about a meeting concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.context: Mentioned as someone with whom a meeting is scheduled on Thursday; likely another attorney or individual involved in the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Meeting Regarding Epstein
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Thursday (likely December 4, 2008) involving Roy, which defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz was asked to attend regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: In December 2008, federal prosecutor A. Marie Villafaña and defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz were communicating about a meeting concerning Jeffrey Epstein.
The emails suggest ongoing legal proceedings or negotiations in the Epstein case in late 2008, following his 2008 guilty plea.
The correspondence is marked as potentially confidential and attorney-client privileged, originating from the law firm Kirkland & Ellis.
The document indicates the involvement of a person named 'Roy' in the scheduled meeting.
